paper_title.en: Schottky and pn junction cryogenic radiation detectors made of p-InSb compound semiconductor
paper_title.ja: Schottky and pn junction cryogenic radiation detectors made of p-InSb compound semiconductor

ja.name: I.Kanno S.Hishiki, H.Murakami, O.Sugiura, Y.Murase, T.Nakamura, M.Katagiri

description.en: Schottky and pn junction detectors were fabricated with p-InSb. Fabrication methods, energy spectra of Am-241 alpha particles and rise times are shown. We could observe pulses at operating temperatures up to 77 and 115 K for the Schottky and the pn junction detectors, respectively. (C) 2003 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT
publication_name.ja: Nuclear Instruments & Methods in Physics Research

paper_title.en: Cryogenic neutron detector comprising an InSb semiconductor detector and a supercritical helium-3 gas converter
paper_title.ja: Cryogenic neutron detector comprising an InSb semiconductor detector and a supercritical helium-3 gas converter

ja.name: Tatsuya Nakamura Masaaki Katagiri, Yasuyuki Aratono, Ikuro Kanno, Shigeomi Hishiki, Osamu Sugiura, Yasuhiro Murase

description.en: We evaluated the neutron-detection characteristics of a proposed cryogenic neutron detector comprising an InSb semiconductor detector and a helium-3 gas converter. The neutron detector was operated at 4.2 K with helium-3 gas filling up to 1.5 atm, at which the density of the helium-3 nucleus corresponds to that at 160 atm at room temperature. The secondary particles generated by the He-3(n,p)T reaction were successfully detected by the InSb detector with a time response of similar to80 ns at all tested gas pressures. (C) 2004 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.ja: 化合物半導体InSbを用いた放射線検出器

ja.name: 神野 郁夫 菱木 繁臣,杉浦 修,村瀬 徳博,中村 龍也,片桐 政樹

paper_title.en: Radiation measurements by a cryogenic pn junction InSb detector with operating temperatures up to 115 K
paper_title.ja: Radiation measurements by a cryogenic pn junction InSb detector with operating temperatures up to 115K

ja.name: I.Kanno Fumiki Yoshihara, Ryo Nouchi, Osamu Sugiura, Yasuhiro Murase, Tatsuya Nakamura, Masaki Katagiri

description.en: Pn junction-type radiation detectors were fabricated with an InSb substrate. The detectors had 1000 times higher resistances than those of previously reported Schottky-type detectors. The output pulses of the preamplifier were analyzed from the point of view of the contribution of electrons and holes. The energy spectra of Am-241 alpha particles were measured at operating temperatures of up to 115 K. The inherent voltage of the detector was estimated. (C) 2003 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.en: Cryogenic InSb detector for radiation measurements
paper_title.ja: Cryogenic InSb detector for radiation measurements

ja.name: Ikuo Kanno Fumiki Yoshihara, Ryo Nouchi, Osamu Sugiura, Tatsuya Nakamura, Masaki Katagiri

description.en: The energy spectra of Am-241 alpha particles were measured by a detector employing the compound semiconductor InSb at an operating temperature below 4.2 K. The fabrication method and current-voltage curves are shown. Though the energy resolution of the detector is not discussed in this article, this is the first report on an InSb radiation detector. (C) 2002 American Institute of Physics.

paper_title.ja: マイクロエレクトロニクス学生実験

ja.name: 小田 俊理 杉浦 修,松村 正清

paper_title.en: NEWLY DESIGNED HG CELL FOR MOLECULAR-BEAM EPITAXY GROWTH OF CDHGTE
paper_title.ja: Newly Designed Hg Cell for Molecular Beam Epitaxy Growth of CdHgTe

ja.name: Ken Haseyama Osamu Sugiura, Ryou Haga, Satoshi Sugahara, Masakiyo Matsumura

description.en: We have designed and constructed a new pressure-controlled Hg cell for molecular beam epitaxy growth of CdHgTe. It generates a stable Hg flux by regulating the vapor pressure with a capacitance manometer/reservoir heater feedback loop. The Hg flux intensity was controlled up to 2.4 x 10(16) cm-2.S-1 by changing the vapor pressure in the Hg reservoir. This Hg cell has the capability to switch the flux on and off and to degas the Hg without introducing Hg into the growth chamber, through the use of valves. A single-crystalline Cd(x)Hg(1-x)Te film with the composition of x = 0.21 was grown using an MBE system equipped with this new Hg cell.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS

paper_title.en: CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION OF AMORPHOUS-SILICON WITH SILANES FOR THIN-FILM TRANSISTORS - THE INFLUENCE OF THE AMORPHOUS-SILICON DEPOSITION TEMPERATURE
paper_title.ja: Chemical Vapour Deposition of Amorphous Silicon with Silanes for Thin Film Transistors -The Influence of the Amorphous Silicon Deposition Temperture-

ja.name: Paul A Breddels Hiroshi Kanoh, Osamu Sugiura, Masakiyo Matsumura

description.en: Amorphous silicon films have been prepared by low pressure chemical vapour deposition of monosilane, disilane and trisilane. The deposition temperatures ranged from 385-degrees-C to 555-degrees-C. The hydrogen content in the films was approximately 3 atomic percent and the optical band-gap was 1.6 approximately 1.7 eV. Simple inverted staggered thin-film transistors were made with thermal silicon dioxide as the gate insulator. After annealing in a hydrogen radical rich ambient the field-effect mobilities for electrons were as high as 2.0 cm2/V.s and almost independent of temperature from 385-degrees-C to 500-degrees-C. At higher temperatures the mobility decreased rapidly and was less than 0.1 cm2/V.s at 555-degrees-C. These results appeared to be independent of the source gas.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES & REVIEW PAPERS

paper_title.en: TOP-GATE AMORPHOUS-SILICON THIN-FILM TRANSISTORS PRODUCED BY CVD METHOD
paper_title.ja: Top-Gate Amorphous-Silicon Thin-Film Transistors Produced by CVD Method

ja.name: Hiroshi Kanoh Msahiro Yasukawa, Osamu Sugiura, Paul A. Breddels, Masakiyo Matsumura

description.en: Chemical-vapor-deposited (CVD) amorphous-silicon films have been applied as the active layer in thin-film transistors with a top-gate structure for the first time. The maximum field-effect mobility and the typical on/off current ratio were more than 0.5 cm2.V-1.s-1 and 10(7), respectively. The characteristics were better than the ones based on plasma-enhanced CVD.

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS & EXPRESS LETTERS

paper_title.en: OPTIMIZATION OF CHEMICAL VAPOR-DEPOSITION CONDITIONS OF AMORPHOUS-SILICON FILMS FOR THIN-FILM TRANSISTOR APPLICATION
paper_title.ja: Optimization of Chemical Vapor Deposition Conditions of Amorphous-Silicon Films for Thin-Film Transistor Application

ja.name: Hiroshi Kanoh Osamu Sugiura, Paul A. Breddels, Masakiyo Matsumura

description.en: The optimum condition has been investigated for chemical vapor deposition (CVD) of amorphous-silicon (a-Si) films to form high-performance a-Si thin-film transistors (TFTs) by a fully plasma-free process. It was found that hydrogen annealings improve the TFT characteristics a great deal and that there is an optimum deposition temperature and gas flow rate. The maximum field-effect mobility of electrons and on/off current-ratio were more than 0.8 cm2V-1s-1 and 10(6), respectively.

ja.name: Honyong Zhang Hiroshi Kanoh, Osamu Sugiura, Shunri Oda, Yasutaka Uchida, Takeo Hattori, Masakiyo Matsumura

publication_name.en: JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES & REVIEW PAPERS

ja.name: Hiroyuki Okada Yasutaka Uchida, Hongyon Zhang, Osamu Sugiura, Masakiyo Matsumura

description.en: Fully self-aligned amorphous-silicon MOS transistors have been proposed and fabricated for the first time. All positions, i.e., an active region, source and drain region, contact holes and metal electrodes are determined by only one photo-mask for the top silicon-nitride layer of a multi-layer structure deposited successively on a glass substrate. The total number of photolithographic steps is 6. On-off current ratio and the maximum field-effect mobility of the fabricated transistor are 105 and 0.25 cm2/Vs, respectively. © 1986 The Japan Society of Applied Physics.
